champ.champInfo:
The overall management of the organization and holding of the competition is carried out by the Department of Culture, Tourism, Youth and Sports of the Brodiv City Council and the Lviv Regional Kyokushin-Kan Karate-Do Federation. The responsibility for the preparation and direct holding of the competition rests with the Lviv Regional Federation of Kyokushin-kan Karate-do and the Chief Jury appointed for this competition .

Organizing committee and judges:

  • The chief judge of the competition is a judge of the international category, Representative (Branch Chief) of the International Kyokushin-kan Karate-do Organization in Ukraine, President of the Lviv Regional Federation of Kyokushin-kan Karate-do Chungin M.P. (5 Dan)
  • Technical support — Tatarchenko I.Yu. (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: Brody, str. Sportivna 1, Yuvileyny stadium

The competition will be held in Brody on May 10-11, 2024.

Competition program

May 10, 2024 (Friday):

  • 10:00-17:00 — arrival of participating teams
  • 17:00-19:00 — mandate and medical commission, weighing, registration of participants, judges and team representatives
  • 19:00-21:00 — judges' seminar under the leadership of the head of the judges' panel of the WFKK Chungin M.P.

May 11, 2024 (Saturday):

  • 08.00-09.00 — registration of competition participants, weighing of athletes, mandate and medical commission
  • 09.00-09.30 - judges' meeting
  • 10.00-13.00 — preliminary matches
  • 14.00-15.00 - ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 15.00-19.00 — final matches
  • 19.00-20.00 — end of the competition, awarding of prize-winners

Competition rules.

  • Competitions are held in the "Kumite" section according to the Olympic system, according to the Kyokushin-kan karate rules approved by the Ministry of Family, Youth and Sports of Ukraine in 2004.
  • Competition judging is conducted in accordance with the standards and rules of the Kyokushin-kan International Karate Organization. The composition of the team: the number of participants in each age and weight category is not limited, a coach-representative and a judge are mandatory.
  • In case of insufficient number of competition participants, presence of different levels and qualifications of athletes in a weight category or other reasons, for the purpose of high-quality and safe conduct of the competition, the organizers of the competition have the right to make the following changes:
    • combine some weight and age categories;
    • introduce new weight and age categories;
    • to hold competitions in the appropriate weight categories according to the round-robin system.

If the athlete does not appear on the tatami after the announcement of his name within 1 minute, the athlete is considered defeated

Categories of participants:

series A - participants with qualification 0-10 kyu series B - participants with qualifications from 9 kyu

Kumite:
Age Gender Series Weight categories Regulations
6-7 Young men Series A and B separately -25 -30 +30 qualifying: 1 min., 1 min. semi-final/final: 1 min., 1 min., 1.5 kg, 1 min.
6-7 Girls Series A and B combined -25 +25 qualifying: 1 min., 1 min. semi-final/final: 1 min., 1 min., 1.5 kg, 1 min.
8-9 Young men Series A and B separately -25 -30 -35 +35 qualifying: 1.5 min., 1.5 min. semi-final/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.0 kg, 1.5 min.
8-9 Girls Series A and B combined -30 -35 +35 qualifying: 1.5 min., 1.5 min. semi-final/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.0 kg, 1.5 min.
10-11 Young men Series A and B combined -30 -35 -40 +40 qualifying: 1.5 min., 1.5 min. semi-final/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.0 kg, 1.5 min.
10-11 Girls Series A and B combined -35 -40 +40 qualifying: 1.5 min., 1.5 min. semi-final/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.0 kg, 1.5 min.
12-13 Young men Series A and B combined -40 -45 -50 +50 qualifying: 1.5 min., 1.5 min. semi-final/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.0 kg, 1.5 min.
12-13 Girls Series A and B combined -40 -45 +45 qualifying: 1.5 min., 1.5 min. semi-final/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.0 kg, 1.5 min.
14-15 Young men Series A and B combined -45 -50 -55 -60 +60 qualifying: 2.0 min., 2.0 min. semi-final/final: 2.0 min., 2.0 min., 3.0 kg, 2.0 min.
14-15 Girls Series A and B combined -50 -55 +55 qualifying: 2.0 min., 2.0 min. semi-final/final: 2.0 min., 2.0 min., 3.0 kg, 2.0 min.
16-17 Young men Series A and B combined -55 -60 -65 -70 +70 qualifying: 2.0 min., 2.0 min. semi-final/final: 2.0 min., 2.0 min., 3.0 kg, 2.0 min.
16-17 Girls Series A and B combined -55 -60 +60 qualifying: 2.0 min., 2.0 min. semi-final/final: 2.0 min., 2.0 min., 3.0 kg, 2.0 min.

Financing

Expenses for the organization and holding of the competition are related to the rent of the premises, food the board of judges and the purchase of award paraphernalia are provided by the public by the organization "Busin-kan Kyokushin Karate-do Sports Club", as well as at the expense of others extrabudgetary revenues. Travel expenses in both directions, accommodation, food, per diem trainers and participants are provided by the sending organizations. Financial terms of participation in competitions are indicated in the appendix to the Regulation

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with cups, medals, diplomas of the respective degrees

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until May 2, 2024. Or to the e-mail of the organizing committee:

Tatarchenkoiu@ukr.net
Ihor Tatarchenko tel. +38(067) 788-77-28

chunhin@ukr.net
Chief judge Mykhailo Chungin tel. +38(050) 430-99-10

The final originals of applications for participation in the competition together with documents that confirm the application data (passports, birth certificate) or personal applications of the participants, necessarily certified by a physical education dispensary, together with an insurance policy, budo passport (certificate or qualification book of the athlete), submitted by the official representative of the team in mandate committee by 09.00 on May 11, 2024. Lately submitted or incorrectly completed applications are not considered
